attributes.action: allow smoking in any residential situation - care home, psychiatric hospital, prison etc - ONLY if it can be PROVEN BEYOND ANY DOUBT not to affect NON-smokers in any way
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
For far too long non-smokers have been forced to endure the effects of a "smokers rule O.K.!" ethos.  The smoking ban was a VERY welcome initiative to consider non-smokers' rights at last but since it applies only to enclosed public places I understand that the institutions I have mentioned are exempt.  I accept that these are people's homes, whether permanently or temporarily, but they are also the homes of NON-amokers (even if rooms/wards/cells are not shared there is a risk of a smoking-related fire) and I feel that it is high time the welfare of non-smokers was considered.  

It may be argued that the situations described could be considered stressful and that the people affected "need" to be able to smoke to relieve this stress; any situation which is stressful for smokers is likely to be equally so for NON-smokers and the smoking, in itself, makes the situation even more stressful for them.  And of course PASSIVE SMOKING can cause many cancers - NOT just lung cancer - and heart disease; why should ANYONE have the right to risk causing potential lethal conditions to an innocent person?
